item.description: Vim has this well-known feature of opening the path under cursor with :h gf . This article explains well how this works .

item.title: Configuring eslint to work with Neovim LSP
item.description: The way we’ll get this to work is by using a generic Language Server called efm-langserver , which is written in Go.

item.title: Asynchronous :make in Neovim with Lua
item.description: The :make command in Vim is quite useful, it runs whatever program is under the makeprg option and returns its output in the quickfix list, where you’ll be able to hop through the errors if they were parsed correctly by the errorformat option.
